N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 7503.1 - Medical

State Regulations
(a) Definite
arrangements shall be in effect so the services of a physician will be
available, on a standby basis, to examine prisoners in cases of illness and
injury. As an alternative, and to provide for situations of an emergency
nature, the facilities of a conveniently located hospital, particularly
emergency ward services, shall be utilized. (b) Every prisoner to be detained who appears
to be physically incapacitated due to drug or alcohol intoxication should
preferably be examined by a physician. Note: Experience has firmly established
that an alcoholic odor emanating from a prisoner can obscure a serious physical
deficiency such as narcotic drug addiction, stroke, diabetic coma, heart
attack, etc., or an abnormal mental condition. (c) No medication shall be given to a
prisoner unless authorized or prescribed by a physician. (d) A record of medical attention provided
for a prisoner shall be maintained. Notes
